isis.stitle: TSI 93-04-06 - New Brake Pads For 2.60, 2.88 and 3.38 Inch Hydraulic Brakes

subjectgroup.subject: New Brake Pads For 2.60, 2.88 and 3.38 Inch Hydraulic Brakes

geninfo.para: This TSI describes new brake pads for 2.60, 2.88 and 3.38 inch hydraulic disc brakes for 1000, 3000 (except 3900) and 4000 truck models.
New chamfered, sealed and rebalanced disc brake pads were introduced January 1, 1993 for all vehicles listed above with 2.88 inch Bendix calipers.
The new pads offer improvements over the old style pads. They are:

item.para: To reduce excessive toe-to-heel taper, a chamfer has been added to the leading end of the outer pad ( Figure 1).
A sealer has been added to the perimeter of the pads ( Figure 1) to eliminate a path for corrosion between the lining and the shoe.
The shoe is now painted to reduce corrosion.
To get more equal wear out of the inner and outer pads, the pads were rebalanced. .060 inch of lining material was moved from the inner pad to the outer pad.

figure.caption: Figure 1. New Bendix 2.88 Disc Brake Pads

geninfo.para: Due to the chamfer of the outer pads, there is now a left and right outer shoe. The shoes are clearly marked with "RH" for the right pad and "LH" for the left pad.
The Service Part number for the new 2.88 (non-3900) disc brake pads is 990953C93.
The new brake pads for vehicles listed above with 3.38 and/or 2.60 inch Bendix calipers now are sealed around the perimeter of the pads and the shoe is painted.
The Service Part number for the new 3.38 and 2.60 inch disc brake pads if 990952C93. To receive the latest part, the suffix must be C93.
